summary: Workflow histories created in v1.11.2 fail to replay in v1.11.5+ with nondeterminism errors about mismatched child workflow IDs. Root cause identified as breaking changes in OpenTelemetry interceptors affecting signal handling and local activity scheduling determinism.
userImpact: Users upgrading from v1.11.2 to v1.11.5+ experience workflow replay failures on existing histories, blocking deployments and requiring version downgrades.
rootCause: Breaking changes in OpenTelemetryInboundInterceptor and OpenTelemetryOutboundInterceptor altered signal handling and local activity scheduling behavior, violating workflow determinism guarantees required for replay.
proposedFix: Revert or fix the OpenTelemetry interceptor changes to restore deterministic behavior for signal handling and local activity scheduling.
workaround: Patch OpenTelemetryInboundInterceptor.handleSignal() and OpenTelemetryOutboundInterceptor.scheduleLocalActivity() to bypass the problematic logic when replaying.
resolutionDetails: Issue traced to OpenTelemetry interceptor changes and addressed in related issue #1677. Users provided working patch for immediate mitigation.
keyQuote: Patch needed because of a change in OpenTelemetryInboundInterceptor that broke determinism
